intro: Hemigymnia macleodii, commonly known as the Macleod's hemigymnia, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
